pullRequest.title: Faster startup time
pullRequest.bodyText:
Why
Our deployment code expects that startup time will be consistent. It will timeout if startup takes too long. The current _since does a full filter refresh during startup. The duration of this operation varies by the number of RIF files recently loaded. This algorithm increases the possibility of a timeout during startup.
Changes
The current design sets up transactionTime during init time, so the server can return Bundles with a transactionTime. Instead of calling refreshFilters during init time, the LoadedFilterManger just fetches transactionTime directly during init time. RefreshFilters will happen periodically in the background as before.
Security Implications
None

commit.message:
Faster startup time

Instead of calling refreshFilters, just set transactionTime during init time. RefreshFilters will happen periodically in the background.

nodes.bodyText: This date is used in the case that the LoadedBatches table is empty. It just needs to be sometime in the past.
lastBatchCreated is set by the refreshFilters.
transactionTime is set by init and refreshFilters
Here's the algorithm change. fetchLastLoadedBatchCreated will have a consistent duration because of the index on LoadedBatches
I've moved this else clause out of this function to the caller for code readability reasons. This logic shouldn't handle the case when the table is empty.

If I'm not mistaken the parameters have changed but the general logic behind this statement has not correct?  I ask because currently in the test environment this is logging every second and causing logs to fill up quite a bit.
Could this be changed to a debug level?
Same as above, this is currently logging every second in test.  Can this be changed to debug?
Is this the equivalent of saying if lastBatchCreated is null or lastBatchCreated is before transactionTime?
